review: First, let me say that Fire TV is a great service and I highly recommend it.  I first purchased the Fire TV "box" that allows for a wired Ethernet connection.  For a second TV I thought I would try the much cheaper Fire TV stick.  The stick uses wireless "WiFi" Ethernet.  Here comes the downside of the stick.  Because it only works over WiFi, in the evening when my neighbors are all at home probing the internet or watching their streaming IP service, the Stick does not have enough bandwidth to deliver service.  For that reason I recommend that you buy the Fire TV box rather than the stick.  Both provide great service, but the box has the hard wired Ethernet, and expanded capacity for compute and bandwidth intensive games.  The remote control that comes with the stick does not have the voice search capability. Let me say that the voice search on the Fire TV box works much better than I ever expected and is probably worth the extra dollars just by itself. If I were to buy another Fire TV it would be the box rather than the stick.  I hope this helps you in your purchase decision.
